definition: lit. pearl flows, jade moves on (idiom); fig. the passage of time/water under the bridge
bead/pearl/CL:粒[li4],顆|颗[ke1]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
jade annulus
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
the passage of the years/the flow of time
(literary) (of time) to slip away
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to twinkle/to glimmer/to glisten
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 斗轉星移|斗转星移[Dou3 zhuan3 xing1 yi2]
etched in one's bones and heart (idiom); ever-present memory (esp. resentment)
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
to remain forever new (idiom)
changeable situation (idiom)
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
as time goes by (idiom)
time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
lit. clouds scatter, wind flows (idiom); the crisis settles down/people disperse home/things return to normal
to help each other out in hard times (idiom)
